properties.areaDesc: Randolph; Sharp; Fulton; Monroe; Saline; Garland; Faulkner; White; Pulaski; Woodruff; Cleburne; Jackson; Lonoke; Izard; Lawrence; Independence; Prairie
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 11 at 6:08PM CST until February 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Little Rock has expanded the

* Flash Flood Watch to include portions of central Arkansas,
eastern Arkansas, and north central Arkansas, including the
following areas, in central Arkansas, Faulkner, Garland,
Lonoke, Prairie, Pulaski, Saline, and White. In eastern
Arkansas, Jackson, Lawrence, Monroe, Randolph, and Woodruff.
In north central Arkansas, Cleburne, Fulton, Independence,
Izard, and Sharp.

* Through Wednesday afternoon

* Periods of showers and thunderstorms are expected over parts of
central, eastern and northern Arkansas through Wednesday. Several
inches of rain will be possible and with an already saturated ground,
flash flooding may occur.

* Since vegetation is dormant, and not consuming much ground
water, runoff from heavy rain will be increased. This elevates
the concern for flash flooding. Also, rapid rises may occur on
creeks, small streams, and flashy rivers.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
